post.description:
Create an empty balance for authorized user who makes the request.
    
If balance already exists, but it is disabled (it was not referred by another user,
but has fulfilled some event), you should activate balance instead.

409.description: Balance already exists for provided nullifier

get.description: Returns leaders sorted by points in descending order.

409.description: Balance already exists and it is not disabled

get.description:
Balance of authorized user who makes the request. Rank in leaderboard is included.
You should create new balance for the new user by making POST request.

If balance is disabled (was created without referral code and not activated),
some fields are not returned.

parameters.name: rank
parameters.description: Specifies whether to return the rank. Has no effect on disabled balance.

parameters.name: referral_codes
parameters.description: Specifies whether to return the referral codes. Has no effect on disabled balance.

patch.description:
Activate points balance for authorized user who makes the request.
Rank is included in response.

Only balances created without referral code can be activated,
check this with `is_disabled` field.

If balance's passport was verified earlier, some events will be auto-claimed.

409.description: Passport already verified or event absent for user.

post.description:
Verify passport to unlock event claiming and get reward.
One passport can't be verified twice.

In body must be specified anonymous_id and shared_hash

Some events will be automatically claimed in case if balance is active.

409.description: Passport already verified or anonymous ID exists

post.description:
Verify passport to unlock event claiming and get reward.
One passport can't be verified twice.

There are two verification flows:
1) Legacy flow is done through Query ZK-proof
2) New flow is done via JWT, received from Auth service after providing ZK-proof

Some events will be automatically claimed in case if balance is active.

409.description: Passport already verified or anonymous ID exists

get.description:
Get a daily question. The user must be 
authorized and verified (passport scanned, 
verified field is true).

404.description: There is no question in current day.

409.description: User already answer current day question.

post.description:
Answer question. The user must be 
authorized and verified (passport scanned, 
verified field is true).

404.description: User haven't active question or deadline already passed.

get.description:
Get the status of questions. The user must be 
authorized and verified (passport scanned, 
verified field is true). 
Returns NotFound if next question absent.

Returns public configuration of all event types.
Basically, it is event static metadata (model `EventStaticMeta`)
for each event type in the system.

parameters.name: filter[name]
parameters.description: Filter by type name. Possible values should be hard-coded in the client.

parameters.name: filter[name][not]
parameters.description: Inverted filter by type name: excludes provided values

parameters.name: filter[flag]
parameters.description: Filter by configuration flags. Values are disjunctive (OR).

post.description:
Creates a new event type. Requires **admin** role in JWT.
The type must not be present in the system.

get.description: Returns public configuration of event type by its unique name

put.description:
Update an existing event type. Requires **admin** role in JWT.
**All attributes** except QR code, Poll Event ID and Poll Contract are
updated, ensure to pass every existing field too.
Although this is not JSON:API compliant, it is much easier to work with
in Go, because differentiating between `{}` and `{"field": null}`
requires custom unmarshalling implementation.

get.description:
Returns configuration of all event types with QR-code.
Basically, it is event static metadata (model `EventStaticMeta`)
for each event type in the system.
Requires **admin** role in JWT.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Ð†pecifies whether to return the number of uses of the event

parameters.name: filter[name]
parameters.description: Filter by type name. Possible values should be hard-coded in the client.

parameters.name: filter[name][not]
parameters.description: Inverted filter by type name: excludes provided values

parameters.name: filter[flag]
parameters.description: Filter by configuration flags. Values are disjunctive (OR).

post.description:
Creates a new event type. Requires **admin** role in JWT.
The type must not be present in the system.

get.description: Returns events for a single user.

parameters.name: filter[status]
parameters.description:
Filter by event status, which is:
  - `open` - you need to do something on the platform
  - `fulfilled` - you have done something and are eligible to claim the reward
  - `claimed` - you have claimed the reward

parameters.name: filter[meta.static.name]
parameters.description: Filter by event type name. Possible values should be hard-coded in the client.

parameters.name: filter[meta.static.name][not]
parameters.description: Inverted filter by event type name: excludes provided values

parameters.name: filter[has_expiration]
parameters.description: Filter events by type which has or hasn't expiration.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Count total number of events for a single user, applying filters.

get.description: Returns a single event by ID.

patch.description:
Update event status to _claimed_ and accrue points.
User must be authorized, and event must be _fulfilled_ by him.

403.description: This event type was disabled and cannot be claimed
This event type was disabled and cannot be fulfilled

post.description: Fulfill event for voting in Georgian poll by sending proof of voting

403.description: This event type was disabled and cannot be fulfilled

is_disabled.description:
Whether the user was not referred with some code. If it wasn't - balance
is disabled and very limited in functionality.

updated_at.description: Unix timestamp of the last points accruing

rank.description: Rank of the user in the full leaderboard. Returned only for the single user.

referral_codes.description: Referral codes. Returned only for the single active balance.

referred_users_count.description: Number of invited users. Returned only for the single active balance.

rewarded_referred_users_count.description: Number of users for whom the reward was received. Returned only for the single active balance.

level.description: The level indicates user permissions and features

is_verified.description: Whether the user has scanned passport. Returned only for the single user.

referred_by.description:
Referral code from the link. Supply it to create the active balance,
otherwise disabled balance is created, and it can be activated later.

Disabled balance is only allowed to verify passport and get.

next_question_date.description:
Time when the next question will be available. 
If the time is in the past, then there is a question 
on this day and the user has not yet answered it. 
If the time is in the future, then the user has either 
already answered the question on the current day or 
there was no question on the current day.

time_for_answer.description: The time within which the user has to answer this question after receiving it.

reward.description: The number of points the user will receive if they answer the question correctly.

errors.description: Non empty array of errors occurred during request processing

title.description: Title is a short, human-readable summary of the problem

detail.description: Detail is a human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem

status.description: Status is the HTTP status code applicable to this problem

updated_at.description: Unix timestamp of the event status change

has_expiration.description: Whether this event may become expired.

points_amount.description:
How many points were accrued. Required only for `claimed` events.
This is necessary, as the reward might change over time, while
the certain balance should be left intact.

claimed.description: If passport scan event was automatically claimed

dynamic.description: Some events require dynamic data, which can be filled into `static` template.

EventStaticMeta.description:
Primary event metadata in plain JSON. This is a template
to be filled by `dynamic` when it's present.

This structure is also reused as request body to event type creation and update.

frequency.description:
Event frequency, which means how often you can fulfill
certain task and claim the reward.

action_url.description: Page where you can fulfill the event

flag.description:
Event configuration flag:
  - active: Events can be opened, fulfilled, claimed
  - not_started: Event are not available yet, see `starts_at`
  - expired: Event is not available, as it has already expired, see `expires_at`
  - disabled: Event is disabled in the system

If event is disabled, it doesn't matter if it's expired or not started:
it has `disabled` flag.

Do not specify this field on creation: this structure is reused for request body too.

auto_claim.description: Whether the event is automatically claimed on fulfillment, or requires manual claim

disabled.description: Whether the event is disabled in the system. Disabled events can only be retrieved.

qr_code_value.description: Base64-encoded QR code. Must match the code provided in event type.

usage_count.description: Number of uses. Only available to the administrator.

poll_event_id.description: Decimal value of the Event ID

proof.description: Proof of voting in some poll.

status.description:
Status of the code, belonging to this user (referrer):
  1. infinity: the code have unlimited usage count and user can get points for each user who scanned passport
  2. active: the code is not used yet by another user (referee)
  3. awaiting: the code is used by referee who has scanned passport, but the referrer hasn't yet
  4. rewarded: the code is used, both referee and referrer have scanned passports
  5. consumed: the code is used by referee who has not scanned passport yet

The list is sorted by priority. E.g. if the referee has scanned passport,
but referrer not, the status would be `consumed`. If both not scann passport yet
status would be `awaiting`.

shared_hash.description: Unique identifier for linking internal and external passports

proof.description:
Query ZK passport verification proof.
Required for passport verification endpoint.

invalidAuth.description: You must provide a valid authorization params.

invalidParameter.description: One of the parameters is invalid. Refer to the response body for details.

filterNullifier.name: filter[nullifier]
filterNullifier.description: Filter by single nullifier. Auth is required for this filter.

headerLang.name: Accept-Language
headerLang.description: Localization of event types. If locale is not configured for the type, the default is returned.

schema.description: Numbers of items per page to return.

pageNumber.name: page[number]
pageNumber.description: The number of the page to return.

schema.description: Order of records on the page.
